availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Blanks (Caldwell co., kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Amanda Frances Greer Blanks in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in February 1855. Father of Edward Blanks, John Blanks, James Blanks, E. I. Blanks, and Robert Blanks. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 364B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 154.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Harmony, p. 449B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 198.
"James F. Blanks (1829-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial #44903520, accessed July 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44903520.
